title: CycloneDX Engineering Requirement Model
$comment: OWASP CycloneDX is an Ecma International standard (ECMA-424) developed in collaboration between the OWASP Foundation and Ecma Technical Committee 54 (TC54). The standard is published under a royalty-free patent policy. This JSON schema is the reference implementation and is licensed under the Apache License 2.0.

requirement.title: Requirement
requirement.description: A requirement represents a specific need, constraint, or capability that must be met.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: A unique identifier for the requirement, often used in requirement management systems (e.g., REQ-001).

name.title: Name
name.description: A short name or title for the requirement.

description.title: Description
description.description: A detailed description of the requirement.

type.title: Requirement Types
type.description: The categories or classifications applicable to the requirement.

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: The priority level of the requirement.

stakeholders.title: Stakeholders
stakeholders.description: The individuals or groups who have an interest in the requirement.

acceptanceCriteria.title: Acceptance Criteria
acceptanceCriteria.description: Criteria that must be met for the requirement to be considered satisfied.

dependencies.title: Dependencies
dependencies.description: Other requirements that this requirement depends on.

parent.title: Parent BOM Reference
parent.description: The optional `bom-ref` to a parent requirement. This establishes a hierarchy of requirements.

rationale.title: Rationale
rationale.description: The reasoning or justification for the requirement.

fitCriterion.title: Fit Criterion
fitCriterion.description: A measurable test that the solution must pass to be acceptable to the stakeholders.

effort.title: Effort Estimation
effort.description: An estimation of the effort required to implement the requirement.

risk.title: Risk
risk.description: The risk level associated with implementing or not implementing the requirement.

attachments.title: Attachments
attachments.description: Files or documents attached to the requirement.

properties.title: Properties
properties.description: Provides the ability to document properties in a name-value store. This provides flexibility to include data not officially supported in the standard.

externalReferences.title: External References
externalReferences.description: External references provide a way to document systems, sites, and information that may be relevant to the requirement.

requirementType.title: Requirement Type
requirementType.description: The category or classification applicable to the requirement.

meta:enum.accessibility: Requirements ensuring inclusive access for people with disabilities or impairments.
meta:enum.auditability: Requirements defining the capability of a system to record activities for review and compliance purposes.
meta:enum.availability: Requirements describing the uptime and operational availability of systems or services.
meta:enum.business: Requirements derived from organizational goals, strategies, or business processes.
meta:enum.compatibility: Requirements ensuring the software or system functions correctly with other systems or legacy components.
meta:enum.compliance: Requirements ensuring adherence to internal policies, industry standards, or external agreements beyond regulatory mandates.
meta:enum.deployment: Requirements related to deploying, configuring, and operating the system in production environments.
meta:enum.functional: Requirements specifying the fundamental behaviors and capabilities of the system or application.
meta:enum.interoperability: Requirements addressing the ability of the system to interact seamlessly with external systems or products.
meta:enum.localization: Requirements specifying adaptations for specific languages, cultures, or regional needs.
meta:enum.maintainability: Requirements aimed at ensuring the ease of performing maintenance, enhancements, or repairs.
meta:enum.non-functional: Requirements that define constraints or qualities such as performance, usability, reliability, etc., rather than specific functionality.
meta:enum.other: Requirements that do not clearly fit into other specified categories.
meta:enum.performance: Requirements specifying response times, throughput, or other efficiency-related aspects.
meta:enum.portability: Requirements enabling the system or components to be transferred easily across various environments or platforms.
meta:enum.privacy: Requirements specifically addressing the handling and protection of personal and sensitive data.
meta:enum.regulatory: Requirements necessary for legal compliance, dictated by laws, regulations, or standards.
meta:enum.reliability: Requirements ensuring the system consistently performs under specified conditions and duration.
meta:enum.scalability: Requirements focused on the ability of the system to grow and manage increased demand effectively.
meta:enum.security: Requirements intended to protect systems, data, and users from malicious actions or threats.
meta:enum.system: Technical requirements defining infrastructure, architecture, or underlying technologies.
meta:enum.testability: Requirements ensuring the system can be effectively validated and tested.
meta:enum.usability: Requirements addressing the ease of use, intuitiveness, and overall user experience.
meta:enum.user: Requirements captured directly from user needs, tasks, and expectations.

requirementStatus.title: Status
requirementStatus.description: The current status of the requirement in the development lifecycle.

acceptanceCriterion.title: Acceptance Criterion
acceptanceCriterion.description: A specific condition that must be met for the requirement to be considered satisfied.

id.title: Identifier
id.description: A unique identifier for the acceptance criterion.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of the acceptance criterion.

status.title: Status
status.description: The current status of the acceptance criterion.

description.title: Description
description.description: A description of the dependency relationship.
